newsitem.title: USA: U.S. chain store sales up 0.3 pct -- BTM/Schroders.
newsitem.headline: U.S. chain store sales up 0.3 pct -- BTM/Schroders.

text.p: U.S. chain store sales rose 0.3 percent in the week ended May 17 from the prior week, according to the seasonally adjusted BTM/Schroders weekly chain store sales index.
The year-over-year percentage change of the adjusted index advanced 5.6 percent during the last reporting week. The month-to-date index rose 0.3 percent from the prior month.
"For May, we continue to expect the monthly aggregate will increase by about 3.5 to 4.0 percent over the prior year, which is a bit stronger than the April performance," the report said.
